oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Snow Benefit at the Grand Ole Opry - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of the Hank Snow Benefit Concert at the Grand Ole Opry. The segment is hosted by T. Tommy Cutrer (musician) and features performances by: Melvin Sloan (musician), the Tennessee Travelers (musical group/dance group), Hank Snow (musician) and Kelly Foxton (musician), and the Hemphills (musical group). The recording is from an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: T. Tommy Cutrer; The Hemphills; Melvin Sloan and the Tennessee Travelers;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) T. Tommy Cutrer introduces the Hemphills -- (00:20) He Wrote My Name (The Hemphills) -- (02:26) Consider the Lilies (The Hemphills) -- (06:13) Thank God I am Free, Free, Free (The Hemphills) -- (08:49) Joe Hemphill describes why the Hemphills choose to sing gospel and to sing at the White House -- (11:35) I'm in This Church (The Hemphills) -- (14:42) Cutrer praises the Hemphills and shows his appreciation for members' donations -- (16:31) Unidentified tune (Melvin Sloan and the Tennessee Travelers) -- (18:37) Cutrer reflects on the legacy of Ralph Sloan and greets the important figures in the audience; additionally, Cutrer introduces Hank Snow -- (24:50) Snow reflects on the progress of the association and introduces Ray Wiggins -- (26:28) Wiggins asks the audience to visualize the progress the Hank Snow Foundation is making -- (35:34) Snow thanks Wiggins and Cutrer introduces Snow -- (36:56) Snow praises the various members who participated in the show
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Sloan, Melvin; Tennessee Travelers; Hemphills (Musical group);
